title: Health Care Down Amid Growing Political Risk — Health Care Roundup
text:
Health-care companies fell as political risks mounted amid reports that Democrats were preparing to launch a formal impeachment investigation of President Donald Trump.

As a heavily regulated area, the health-care sector is particularly sensitive to changes in the power dynamics in Washington.

"Due to the recent developments relating to opioid litigation...there's a reasonable risk of opioid-related settlements or judgements against certain drug manufacturers that could exceed a billion dollars," said analysts at credit-ratings firm S&P Global Ratings, in a statement.

Hundreds of new cases of lung injuries linked to e-cigarettes have arisen during federal and state investigations over the past week, an official from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention told House lawmakers Tuesday during a hearing on vaping. Massachusetts Governor Charlie Baker unveiled a four-month ban on all vaping products, declaring a health emergency.

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina and Cambia Health Solutions said their deal to combine is on hold following recent revelations about the arrest of the North Carolina insurer's chief executive in June tied to an allegedly alcohol-related traffic accident, as reported earlier.
